meanings.definition: Feel or show fear or apprehension.
meanings.sent1: The little boy quailed at the sight of the dark, spooky forest.
meanings.sent2: She quailed at the thought of having to speak in front of a large audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat quailed when it saw the vacuum cleaner coming towards it.
meanings.sent4: His confidence quailed as he faced the intimidating opponent in the boxing ring.
meanings.sent5: The hiker quailed as the storm clouds gathered ominously overhead.

meanings.definition: Lose heart or courage in difficulty or danger.
meanings.sent1: The soldier quailed when he realized he was outnumbered.
meanings.sent2: She quailed at the idea of giving up on her dream.
meanings.sent3: The student quailed at the thought of failing the important exam.
meanings.sent4: His determination quailed as the challenges piled up before him.
meanings.sent5: The athlete quailed as the opposing team scored another goal.

meanings.sent1: The puppy quailed in the corner during the thunderstorm.
meanings.sent2: She quailed under the fierce gaze of her angry boss.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit quailed as the fox approached stealthily.
meanings.sent4: His knees quailed as he faced the towering giant in the arena.
meanings.sent5: The child quailed behind their parent when the fireworks started.
